newsitem.title: UK: UK shares open steady, helped by firm Wall St.
newsitem.headline: UK shares open steady, helped by firm Wall St.

text.p: London shares started steady to slightly higher on Wednesday after modest overnight gains in U.S. shares and bonds sparked an early mark-up in prices.

By 0736 GMT the FTSE 100 was trading 5.1 points higher at 3,910.8 -- an all-time high -- but after the extended holiday weekend, volumes are again expected to be light with little on the economic or corporate front to excite activity.

Shares in the one major UK company with results today, W H Smith, made modest headway after the company reported a pre-tax loss of 194.7 million stg for the 12 months to June 1. Shortly after the start the shares were up 2p at 517-1/2p.
